decks.notes: This aggro deck focuses on quickly getting Arclight Phoenix into the graveyard and bringing them back to the battlefield, leveraging cheap spells such as Consider and Lightning Axe to trigger their ability. The deck also includes disruptive cards such as Ashiok, Dream Render and Spell Pierce to disrupt opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes card draw spells like Opt and Treasure Cruise to keep the deck running smoothly. Hall of Storm Giants provides a powerful finisher, making it difficult for opponents to come back once the deck gains momentum.

This deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to draw multiple cards and gain card advantage while controlling the board with a variety of removal spells and versatile threats. The deck also includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to provide additional value and flexibility. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure access to a wide range of colors, allowing for the deck to consistently cast its powerful spells. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponent through a combination of card advantage, removal, and powerful threats.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize various spells and cards to quickly fill up the graveyard with instants and sorceries, allowing the player to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard multiple times in a single turn. The deck focuses on aggression and tempo, using cards like Opt, Lightning Axe, and Treasure Cruise to dig for more spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix. It also includes disruptive cards like Ashiok, Dream Render and Spell Pierce to control the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and Phoenixes.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to gain advantage by disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also aims to generate value by utilizing cards like Waste Not and Bitter Triumph, while maintaining control through powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. Additionally, the deck includes graveyard hate with cards like Cling to Dust and utilizes lands like Field of Ruin and Geier Reach Sanitarium for additional disruption and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with low-cost creatures and utilizing combat tricks and burn spells to push through damage and overwhelm the opponent. By taking advantage of the synergy between creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Tenth District Legionnaire, as well as spells like Defiant Strike and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to consistently pressure the opponent and finish them off before they can stabilize. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a powerful companion option that can provide additional mana ramp in the late game.
